div.div: This search form uses an instant search feature. As you type, search results will appear automatically below the search field. When you've entered you desired search terms use tab to navigate through the available results and hit enter to open the selected page or document.

img.div:
School Closure Update
CCS
Monday, March 23, 2020
img.p: On Thursday, April 16, 2020 Governor Andrew Cuomo announced New York State schools and non-essential businesses will remain closed through May 15, 2020, saying the coronavirus pandemic still makes it unsafe to resume regular daily lives. Therefore, Clymer Central School has extended it's closure through Friday, May 15, 2020. Academic packets for elementary students were delivered and remote instruction began for secondary students March 18, 2020. Students in grades 5-12 should be checking their emails regularly for messages from their teachers. Please click the following link for more information on Quarter 3 Grades: QUARTER 3 GRADING UPDATE

In accordance with the Coronavirus Health and Safety Guidelines, the CCS tennis courts are locked up and all sports fields and playgrounds are no longer accessible. This is implemented to prohibit any group activity. Signage has been posted in the affected areas as a public notice to the community. The walking trail is not affected as long as social distancing practices are followed. Also, no one is allowed into the building during this time. Until further notice, only authorized personnel will be allowed to enter the building on designated days.

If you are interested in receiving bagged meals for your children during this closure, you may still sign up for food deliveries. Please complete the CCS Parent Survey for Emergency School Closure under the COVID 19 Information tab, or call the cafeteria office at 716-355-2014. Continue to check the district website for updates. Food delivery will take place directly to the residences of those who have responded between 7:30-10:00am on the dates below. A parent or student must meet the bus and remove their food package from the bus steps.

FOOD DELIVERY SCHEDULE:
Wednesday, March 18, 2020
Tuesday, March 24, 2020
Friday, March 27, 2020
Tuesday, March 31, 2020
Friday, April 3, 2020
Tuesday, April 7, 2020
Thursday, April 9, 2020
Wednesday, April 15, 2020
Tuesday, April 21, 2020
Friday, April 24, 2020
Tuesday, April 28, 2020
Friday, May 1, 2020
Tuesday, May 5, 2020
Friday, May 8, 2020
Tuesday, May 12, 2020
Friday, May 15, 2020

Child care services will be made available to families who are considered essential to the health and safety of the community. Families who are considered essential workers and cannot be excused from work are encouraged to complete the Child Care Need Survey. Click the following link for further information: Child Care Services for Essential Workers
